result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard M. PEASE III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $29,288.85 to John Becker, E2818 Krok Road, Kewaunee, WI  54216 from cash bail.

Attend anger management counseling and follow through.

Provide DNA sample and pay.

No contact with the victims without agent's approval.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC and Sheriff
Letters in Support for the defendant.

Count 1 - Substantial Battery - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, substantial battery.  Motion granted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing set for 04-24-15 at 10:30 a.m.  Report due by 04-17-15.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes.

Amended Information charges:
Count 1 - Substantial Battery, contrary to Section 940.19(2) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
Count 2 - Substantial Battery, contrary to Section 940,19(2) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
Jury trial noticed returned and remailed to Attorney Skvara at 129 N. Madison Street, Green Bay, WI 54301.

Status conference is set for 02-02-15 at 10:00 .am.
Jury trial is set for 02-12-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 2 position.

Defense counsel asks for approximately 60 more days to work through discovery.   
Plea date reset to 12-02-14 at 2:00 p.m.

Minutes.
RE:  John Becker and Jon Webster, on 06-01-14.

At 1:29 p.m., $30,000.00 cash bail posted and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash bail (2)

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts substantial battery.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-09-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $30,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with John J. Becker, Jr., John H. Webster and with Bonkers Bar or any other tavern and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
